newsitem.title: UZBEKISTAN: IMF mission to start Uzbekistan visit Thursday.
newsitem.headline: IMF mission to start Uzbekistan visit Thursday.

text.p: A mission of the International Monetary Fund will arrive in the former Soviet republic of Uzbekistan on Thursday, a senior fund official said on Tuesday.

"A mission from the IMF will arrive in Uzbekistan this week to carry out the annual...consultations between the IMF and Uzbekistan," the fund's resident representative, Mark O'Brien, told Reuters by telephone.
He said the misson visit, which will last until May 13, was routine.

However relations between the largely desert but resource-rich nation of 23 million and the fund are strained following the IMF's decision to suspend disbursements of a $185 million standby loan to the republic.
The fund said it had suspended the loan as Uzbekistan had failed to meet IMF inflation targets and was critical of the country's foreign exchange controls.
